history.content:
I think it's pretty unlikely given past enrollment policies of this class. Also, you can always take these classes in PhD years with more updated content! 

Otherwise, given you mentioned you are a senior persuing PhD in NLP, I assme you are currently working in a related lab and applying this semester. You can talk to your PI to see if he/she can get you enrolled on the basis of research need.

children.subject: I am an undergrad who took CS 288 last Spring - there were about 5 of us total. If you are already working in NLP, you may be able to get in if you talk to your research advisor or go for the first couple classes and ask after class. Even if you can't get in do to enrollment difficulties, I highly recommend you audit it! It covers a different subsection of NLP than Info 159 in my experience and other than the projects I did not find that it was too load heavy.

history.content: Hi I am a graduating undergraduate senior in 2021 and I am wondering if CS288 is going to take undergrads in Spring semester. For brief intro of my background, I have taken cs189 and info159, and I am taking cs285. I would like to go study phd in NLP and had research experience in this field before. I have heard it is hard for undergrads to get into this class, may I ask will the class be open to undergrads in Spring 2021?
history.subject: CS288 Enrollment for undergrads Spring 2021
